div.p: RATNAGIRI or Rtttnagherry, chief town of the above district, is situated on the Konkan coast in lb 3 59' X. lat. and 73° 19' E. long., 136 miles south by east of Bombay. A leading industry connected with the town is the sardine fishery, which usually takes place in January and February, and engages fleets of canoes. A single net-caster will fill his canoe in the course of a morning. The lighthouse w־as erected in 1867 ; its light, visible 18 miles distant, is 250 feet above high water. The population of the town in 1881 numbered 12,616 (males 6418, females 6198).
